result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael James Boho Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Court ordered cash bail to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court ordered any cash bail on read-in case 15CM1229 to be transferred to this case and applied to costs, fees, and surcharges.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Provide a DNA sample and pay all applicable surcharges.

No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No contact with victim without approval of the court.
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
Complete a parenting teenagers class.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael James Boho Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR RESTITUTION/COURT OBLIGATIONS RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.  rmm

Defendant Michael James Boho in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months in the House of Correction with credit for 28 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 1 with credit for zero days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 40 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens. 
-No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim without approval of the court.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Court ordered cash bail to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Court ordered any cash bail on read-in case 15CM1229 to be transferred to this case and applied to costs, fees, and surcharges.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Maintain employment.
-Complete a parenting teenagers class.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Provide a DNA sample and pay all applicable surcharges.
Received and filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Defendant Michael James Boho in court with Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  
Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

**CASE HEARD BY BRANCH 44 FOR BRANCH 40**

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

AS TO COUNT 3:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on state's motion, the Court orders Count 3 DISMISSED AND READ-IN for the purpose of sentencing in Counts 1 and 2.

The Court vacates Jury Trial set for 8-12-15.  Case adjourned to allow for victim notification.  Case returned to Branch 40.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case sent to Branch 44 for plea hearing as this court is in trial.  rmm

Defendant Michael James Boho in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  On motion of the state, Court ordered 15CM1229 and 15CM1403 joined for the purpose of trial.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
 No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Maria B; Jasmin A; Ashley B.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael James Boho in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Michael James Boho in custody.  
Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
